title: Breeding incompetence
body:
Downvotes incoming

In an ideal world players start their climb on ladder straight at level 1. New or not you still have a rating. The point of ratings are to tell you where you stand and they still exist in normal draft or ranked draft. It's just that there is no visible rank in normals.

To put it simply everyone who supports keeping normal draft alive are players who don't take league matches seriously, or sucks so much that they are insecure about getting a rating that accurately shows their skill level.

There is no reason to NOT play ranked.  Practice? The best practice would be against other players who are playing to win, not other players who just want to practice too. Being scared of losing rating in ranked is a pitiful reason for keeping normal draft. More so if the fear is from knowingly having radical picks in champ select.

edit: Answer to all future posts: It's more likely for someone on your team to have mastery 7 on a champion and feed their butts off even when trying their hardest than getting someone on your team who simply plays to lose by picking radically incompetent champion choices in the wrong roles,(such as soraka jungle or twitch support). then again, I haven't experienced bronze or silver for a couple years. SO, hypotethical incompetent picks are not exactly a strong contention point for drafts being merged, because these kind of troll picks happen in ranked regardless of there being an open normal draft queue 24/7.

He doesn't want to try and learn a new support when he has an adc Taric or whatever other abomination blind pick typically breeds. When you're trying to climb in ranked do you really want a first time Nidalee support? If normal blind were to be taken away in NA, this is the type of player you risk having on your team. No they will not try to train over in blind pick because they will tired of all of trolls and people simply screwing around.

Serious questions. For me, I wouldn't want to so I"m just trying to see why someone would then. Since I'd never want to do that, I'd never put anyone through it which is why I play normal drafts when learning a new champion or trying some funky pick out. Just because I play normal draft doesn't mean I'm playing just to practice...I still play to win...I still want to win and do my best.

Or some people just want that chill atmosphere that you get more from normals because some people take ranked so seriously.  

Either way, I see no reason to remove it....it's not hurting ranked in any way so what's there to lose for us players?

Hey I'll label your paragraphs by numbers in chrono order.

1. It's silly how players who are trying to keep normal draft always use hypotheticals that only happen to them. It happens to everyone. The possibility of it happening on either team is equal.
2. Well, looking past your falsely premised rhetoricals, you are assuming first time on a champion always sucks, which is a trademark of low elo. It's very very widely accepted that if you reach the very top of the ladder, you can play any champion decently compared to a low eloer. Building skills on any champion builds skills for other champions too. Positioning, decision making, damage calculations. 
3.
4. people don't get better by playing against bots 24/7. Why would it stay true for mastering a champion in a "normal" game.
5. If they want to chill, let them drop their rating? I get that league is just a game but if you do not play to win you should be punished accordingly. And of course by punish I mean a simple drop in rating.
6. I will touch lightly on the many reasons the positives of a merging of essentially merging all draft queues into a single entity. Like I said, let people who don't take the game seriously find other people who just want to chill. Faster queue times. eh

>In an ideal world players start their climb on ladder straight at level 1.

They do with league.   Mmr starts at lvl 1.  Your normal mmr then helps set your mmr when you jump into ranked.

>To put it simply everyone who supports keeping normal draft alive are players who don't take league matches seriously


No.  For most it is about giving people a place to "Practice" outside of ranked.   A great place to learn new champions and test patch changes.

>There is no reason to NOT play ranked.

You smoking something?   Not everyone wants to TRYHARD all day long.

>The best practice would be against other players who are playing to win

True.   However this doesn't always allow for reflection during the match.


>Being scared of losing rating in ranked is a pitiful reason for keeping normal draft. More so if the fear is from knowingly having radical picks in champ select.


I don't believe fear is the reason most want to keep normal draft.   Also projecting feelings onto others doesn't help your argument.

I'll number your contentions for you and me

1. I did say that it does happen like that
2. Why practice with objectively less competent people
3. If you don't want to try your best 24/7 accept your rank? 
4. Playing against better players makes for worst reflection after a match over playing against objectively less competent players?
5. Sorry just pretend I said "is not a good reason" instead of pitiful.  AND , yes not wanting to lose rating because you have first time championers or wanting to try a champ for the first time is a top top reason for wanting to keep normal draft.
